description: A winter island in the Grand Line covered in snow year-round, with distinctive rock formations shaped like drums. Formerly known as the Drum Kingdom before its tyrannical king Wapol fled from pirate attacks.

keyEvents.title: Drum Island First Sighting
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats spot Drum Island for the first time, a winter island covered in snow with distinctive drum-shaped rock formations.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of the setting for a major arc that will introduce Tony Tony Chopper to the series.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Drum Island's Shore
keyEvents.description: The Going Merry reaches the shore of Drum Island and anchors near a river.
keyEvents.significance: The crew reaches their destination, beginning the Drum Island Arc.

keyEvents.title: Hostile Reception
keyEvents.description: Dalton and armed villagers confront the Straw Hats, ordering them to leave due to the island's traumatic history with pirates.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the island's distrust of pirates and hints at its dark past.

statusHistory.reason: Island is inhabited and active during this episode

description: Wapol's distinctive submarine-capable pirate ship with a round hull covered in metal plating and a hippopotamus figurehead. The first submarine vessel shown in the One Piece series, capable of traveling underwater and surfacing to attack other ships.

keyEvents.title: The Bliking Emerges
keyEvents.description: The Bliking emerges from beneath the ocean near the Going Merry, revealing itself as a submarine ship.
keyEvents.significance: First submarine vessel shown in One Piece, demonstrating unique Grand Line technology.

statusHistory.reason: Ship is operational and used by Wapol's crew

description: A village on Drum Island located near the river where the Straw Hat Pirates docked. Dalton's home is in this village, where he takes the Straw Hats to explain the island's situation.

keyEvents.title: Bighorn Village Introduction
keyEvents.description: The crew is led to Bighorn village by Dalton, who takes them to his home to discuss their situation.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces Bighorn as a safe haven on Drum Island where the crew can learn about the island's history.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel gifted by Kaya. In this episode, it suffers damage when Wapol eats part of its railing.

keyEvents.title: Going Merry Damaged by Wapol
keyEvents.description: Wapol uses his Baku Baku no Mi ability to eat a large chunk of the Going Merry's railing, damaging the ship.
keyEvents.significance: One of several incidents where the Going Merry takes significant damage during its journey.

statusHistory.reason: Wapol ate part of the ship's railing
